resources.string: Be informed and up-to date with the latest articles and research materials on HIV
Talk and Share experiences with doctors and other people living with HIV
Booking appointments and clinic visits online help save time waiting on long queues

HIV is a virus that damages the immune system. Untreated HIV affects and kills CD4 cells, which are a type of immune cell called T cell. 
Over time, as HIV kills more CD4 cells, the body is more likely to get various types of conditions and cancers. 
HIV is transmitted through bodily fluids that include: 

1.blood 
2.semen 
3.vaginal and rectal fluids 
4.breast milk
.....

To develop AIDS, a person has to have contracted HIV. 
But having HIV doesnâ€™t necessarily mean that someone will develop AIDS. 

Cases of HIV progress through three stages: 
stage 1: acute stage, the first few weeks after transmission 
stage 2: clinical latency, or chronic stage 
stage 3: AIDS

HIV is a variation of a virus that can be transmitted to African chimpanzees. 
Scientists suspect the simian immunodeficiency virus (SIV) jumped from chimps to humans when people consumed chimpanzee meat containing the virus. 
Once inside the human population, the virus mutated into what we now know as HIV. 
This likely occurred as long ago as the 1920s.
